item.title: A Marriage Proposal With Strings Attached
item.content:encoded: Mina Frazer faces mounting pressure to marry Alfred Westwood, who warns her that her expected inheritance may disappear. As Malcolm’s past misconduct unsettles their powerful uncle, Westwood hints he could help—or step aside and let their fortunes fall. Torn between independence and security, Mina refuses to be coerced, even as uncertainty tightens around her family.

item.title: The New Insider Risk: AI Changes How Data Moves Inside the Enterprise
item.content:encoded: AI has shifted insider risk from malicious intent to workflow convenience. Employees use generative AI tools that move data across CRMs, Slack, APIs, and third-party apps in seconds—often without visibility. Traditional DLP and IAM controls can’t track these multi-hop flows. According to Proofpoint, insider-driven data loss is rising, pushing CISOs to build AI-specific governance fast.

item.title: Why Amazon Dynamo Still Shapes Modern Distributed Storage 17 Years Later
item.content:encoded: Dynamo is a distributed key-value storage system. It was designed to support Amazon’s high-traffic services such as the shopping cart and session management systems. Dynamo does not provide linearizability or global ordering guarantees.

item.title: Designing Data Pipelines for Regulated Industries
item.content:encoded: Designing Data Pipelines for Regulated IndustriesA missed record in a compliance pipeline means a regulatory fine, a failed audit, or worse. Every single record needs to be ingested, parsed, normalized, and stored with a full audit trail. No two data providers behave the same way.

item.title: Why AI Agents Work in Demos But Fail in Production
item.content:encoded: At 90% accuracy per step, a 20-step agent succeeds 12% of the time. Your demo didn't show you that. Production will.

item.title: A Comprehensive Guide to Stablecoins: Types, Risks, and the Future of Digital Money
item.content:encoded: Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies designed to maintain a stable value, solving the volatility problem that makes Bitcoin and other cryptos unsuitable for daily transactions. There are four main types: fiat-backed (like USDT), asset-backed (like PAX Gold), algorithmic (like DAI), and calibration-based (like O coin). Each has different mechanisms, risks, and use cases. Fiat-backed coins offer simplicity but require trust in centralized reserves. Asset-backed coins provide tangible backing but face supply limitations. Algorithmic coins are decentralized but can fail under extreme conditions. Calibration-based coins offer unlimited supply and stability through real-world price observation. Understanding these differences is crucial for anyone navigating the cryptocurrency space.

item.title: Transitioning from University to Tech Giants: Surprises & Strategies
item.content:encoded: Think you're ready for Big Tech because you aced Data Structures? Think again. A Senior Engineer reflects on the leap from the "clean" world of academia to the messy reality of Amazon, Microsoft, and Salesforce. From the death of Spring Break to the strategic power of asking "stupid" questions, here is why your degree was just the entry ticket and how to survive the 40-year marathon of professional engineering.

item.content:encoded: Google Antigravity is an agentic development platform that can remember context and execute complex instructions. But the platform is only as smart as the architect directing it.

item.title: How Fixing Clinical Documentation Became Foster AI’s Wedge Into India’s Healthcare System
item.content:encoded: Foster AI is tackling one of India’s biggest healthcare bottlenecks: clinical documentation. By enabling doctors in public hospitals to dictate notes that AI converts into structured, traceable records, the company reduces administrative burden and documentation errors. With deployments at Tata Memorial and expansion to AIIMS and PGI, Foster AI is quietly building the data foundation India’s healthcare system has long lacked.

item.title: Meet the Writer: Yash, College Undergrad
item.content:encoded: He hates the "AI bubble," plays chess, and procrastinates until the last minute. Meet the undergrad decoding Zero-Knowledge proofs.

item.title: Connect WhatsApp to Claude Seamlessly with whatsapp-mcp-go
item.content:encoded: This guide shows how to connect your personal WhatsApp account to Claude Desktop using whatsapp-mcp-go, a lightweight Go-based MCP bridge. With Docker or manual setup, you can send messages, voice notes, search chats, and manage media directly from Claude—locally, privately, and without switching apps.

item.title: SIFX Reports Growth in Multi-Asset Trading Activity
item.content:encoded: Retail trading in 2026 is shifting toward diversified, multi-asset strategies—and SIFX is seeing measurable growth across forex, commodities, crypto CFDs, and indices. Instead of concentrating on a single market, traders are rotating capital across asset classes within a unified account. Improved mobile access, structured margin visibility, and cross-asset flexibility are driving sustained platform engagement.

item.title: Your Government Bought an AI Agent. Nobody Taught Anyone How to Use It.
item.content:encoded: AI in local government often fails because it's used as a passive FAQ bot. Drawing on global methodologies from Dubai's One Million Prompters initiative, this article outlines a 'Civic AI Framework.' By mastering prompt engineering, residents can use agentic AI like Readyly to audit local data, propose community solutions, and turn digital transparency into real-world action

item.title: Agentic AI in Payments: Balancing Autonomy and Risk
item.content:encoded: AI agents now approve or decline your payments in milliseconds, but false positives cost more than fraud itself. In high-stakes, regulated systems like payments, autonomous AI can’t operate unchecked. The winning strategy combines human-in-the-loop oversight, strict guardrails, and constrained agent design. The future of fintech isn’t smarter AI—it’s safer AI systems built for trust, scale, and accountability.

item.title: From Rails to Agents: Aurum Foundation CEO Bryan Benson on Why AI Will Massify Crypto Finance
item.content:encoded: Bryan Benson, CEO of Aurum Foundation, talks about AI and the future of finance. He says the industry is shifting toward AI as the true interface for financial decisions. The architecture that makes this workable is permission and proof, he says.

item.title: The Next Trillion-Dollar AI Shift: Why OpenClaw Changes Everything for LLMs
item.content:encoded:
OpenClaw is an open-source, model-agnostic agent framework that runs entirely on your local machine — no cloud, no API keys, no recurring costs.
It connects to Ollama (or LM Studio / llama.cpp) to serve open-weight LLMs like Minimax M2.5 and GLM-5 locally.
Combined with hardware like the Apple Mac M3 Max (128GB unified memory) or NVIDIA DGX Spark (128GB, 1 petaFLOP FP4), it creates a Complete Local Agent Command Center.
Agents can write code, analyze data, browse files, and orchestrate multi-step workflows — all offline and private.
MiniMax Agent (M2.5) is a powerful cloud benchmark; OpenClaw replicates its autonomous capabilities locally with open-weight models.
The setup is straightforward: install Ollama → pull models → clone OpenClaw → configure YAML → block outbound traffic → launch.
Your data never leaves your machine.
Memory, skills, and context are stored as plain Markdown and YAML files.
This is the shift from renting intelligence to owning it.

item.title: AI Is About to Break Your BI Architecture (If You Don't Redesign It First)
item.content:encoded: AI doesn’t fix BI architecture - it stress-tests it. If your dashboards rely on live warehouse queries, AI will multiply cost volatility and instability. The future isn’t real-time. It’s decision-aligned architecture: governed ingestion, scoped semantic models, and execution discipline before intelligence.

item.title: CERN이 1989년 원조 웹 브라우저를 재구현 (2019)
item.content:encoded:
• 1990년 CERN의 NeXT 컴퓨터에서 개발된 WorldWideWeb 애플리케이션은 오늘날 웹의 시초로 평가됨
  • 2019년, 개발 30주년을 기념해 CERN이 현대 브라우저 안에서 실행 가능한 원조 브라우저 복원판을 제작
  • 이 프로젝트는 CERN & Society Foundat...

item.title: 중국 CXMT, DDR4 반값 공급으로 삼성·SK의 HBM4 경쟁에 압박
item.content:encoded:
• 중국 CXMT가 DDR4 메모리 가격을 절반 수준으로 인하하며, 글로벌 공급 부족 속에서 구형 DRAM 시장 점유율 확대를 시도
  • HP·Dell 등 미국 기업과 Asus·Acer 등 대만 기업이 CXMT 제품 품질 테스트 및 협력 검토에 나서며 수요 증가 조짐
  • 삼성과...

item.title: zclaw - ESP32에서 888KB로 구동되는 개인용 AI 비서
item.content:encoded:
• ESP32 보드에서 동작하는 초경량 AI 비서로, 전체 펌웨어 크기가 888KiB 이하로 제한
  • C 언어로 작성되었으며, GPIO 제어·스케줄링(cron)·지속 메모리·사용자 정의 도구를 자연어로 조합 가능
  • Wi-Fi, TLS/암호화, 인증서 번들...

item.title: AI uBlock 블랙리스트
item.content:encoded:
• uBlock Origin에서 AI가 생성한 콘텐츠 공장 사이트를 차단하기 위한 공개 블랙리스트 프로젝트
  • 생성형 AI가 작성한 웹사이트는 광고와 추천 링크로 채워져 있으며 신뢰할 수 없는 정보를 포함하는 경우가 많음
  • 사용자는 list....

item.title: 죽은 멀티플레이 게임을 되살리는 사이트, GameDate
item.content:encoded:
• 오래된 멀티플레이 게임 세션을 다시 열어 플레이어를 모집하는 커뮤니티 기반 플랫폼
  • 사용자는 지역(NA, EU 등)과 시간대별로 ‘LIVE’ 또는 예정된 게임 이벤트를 확인 가능
  • 목록에는 Lethal League Blaze, Kane & Lynch...

item.title: Show HN: Local-First Linux MicroVMs for macOS
item.content:encoded: Comments

item.title: Show GN: 노캔뉴스 업데이트: '이슈 딥다이브' 기능 추가
item.content:encoded:
안녕하세요, 한달 전 도파민 빼고 맥락만 남기는 뉴스레터 '노캔뉴스'를 긱뉴스에 소개했던 1인 개발자입니다.

그동안 데일리 뉴스를 발행하면서, 매일의 단발성 뉴스만으로는 특정 이슈들의 전체 그림이 보이지 않는 문제를 해결하기 위해 새로운 기능인 '이슈 딥다이브'를 만들었습니다.

  • 기능

item.title: Andrej Karpathy가 말하는 "Claws"
item.content:encoded:
• Claws는 LLM 기반 AI 에이전트 위에 구축된 새로운 계층으로, 오케스트레이션·스케줄링·컨텍스트 관리·도구 호출·지속성 등을 확장하는 구조
  • Andrej Karpathy는 Mac Mini를 구입해 OpenClaw를 실험하며, 이를 “흥미롭고 흥분되는 AI 스택의 새로...

item.title: LLM을 칩 위에 ‘인쇄’하는 Taalas의 방식
item.content:encoded:
• Taalas는 Llama 3.1 8B 모델을 ASIC 칩에 직접 새겨 넣어 초당 17,000토큰 추론 속도를 달성한 스타트업
  • GPU 기반 시스템보다 10배 저렴하고, 10배 적은 전력, 그리고 10배 빠른 추론 성능을 주장함

item.title: Show HN: 3D Mahjong, Built in CSS
item.content:encoded: Comments

item.title: Show HN: Rendering 18,000 videos in real-time with Python
item.content:encoded: Comments

item.title: 모든 AI 어시스턴트 개발 기업은 이제 광고 회사임
item.content:encoded:
• 주요 AI 기업들이 광고 수익에 기반한 비즈니스 모델로 전환하며, 사용자 주변의 모든 시각·청각 정보를 수집하는 하드웨어 중심의 AI 어시스턴트를 개발 중임
  • 이러한 항상 켜져 있는(Always-on) AI는 음성 호출어 없이도 사용자의 일상 대화를 인...

item.title: ntransformer - 싱글 RTX 3090에서 Llama 3.1 70B를 실행하는 NVMe-to-GPU 추론 엔진
item.content:encoded:
• C++/CUDA 기반 LLM 추론 엔진으로, GPU 메모리 스트리밍과 NVMe 직접 입출력을 통해 Llama 70B 모델을 RTX 3090(24GB VRAM) 에서 실행 가능
  • 3단계 적응형 캐싱 구조를 사용해 VRAM, 고정 RAM, NVMe/mmap을 자동 분할하며, mmap 대비 최...

item.title: Show HN: TLA+ Workbench skill for coding agents (compat. with Vercel skills CLI)
item.content:encoded: Comments

item.title: Show GN: ios용 모아키 키보드 - 오픈소스로 공개합니다
item.content:encoded:
ios에서 즐겨 쓰던 모아키 대용 'dev keyboard'라는 앱이 1달 전 즈음부터 앱스토어에서 내려갔습니다.
도저히 모바일 쿼티 키보드는 못 쓰겠더라고요.
그래서 직접 ios용 모아키 키보드를 개발했습니다.
3주 정도 실사용하면서 나름 괜찮아졌다고 생각해 공개합니다.
감사합니다!

item.title: Bluesky를 경계하라
item.content:encoded:
• ATProto 기반의 Bluesky는 탈중앙화를 약속하지만, 실제로 대부분의 사용자 데이터가 Bluesky 서버에 집중되어 있음
  • 사용자는 개인 데이터 서버(PDS)를 직접 운영할 수 있지만, 편의성과 호환성 때문에 거의 모두 Bluesky의 기본 서버를 이용함...

item.title: Claude는 왜 Electron 앱일까?
item.content:encoded:
• Electron은 HTML·CSS·JS 기반으로 Windows, Mac, Linux를 동시에 지원하는 데스크톱 앱을 만들 수 있는 프레임워크로, Slack·Discord·VS Code 등 다수의 앱이 이를 사용함
  • 그러나 각 앱이 Chromium 엔진을 개별 포함하기 때문에 용량이 크고,

item.title: 美 백악관, 인도 AI 임팩트 서밋서 ‘AI 주권’ 선언…“미국 AI가 글로벌 표준”
item.content:encoded:
미국, 인도 AI 임팩트 서밋서 "미국산 AI가 글로벌 골드 표준" 선언

URL: https://www.aninews.in/news/world/us/us-promotes-ai-sovereignty-and-exports-at-india-ai-impact-summit20260220133052

서밋 개요

2026년 2월 16~21일 인도 뉴델리 바라트 만

item.title: 창작자를 위한 취향 (2002)
item.content:encoded:
• 좋은 디자인과 미적 감각은 단순한 취향(Taste)이 아니라, 기술적 능력을 뛰어넘어 아름다움을 인식하고 구현하는 능력
  • 수학, 회화, 건축, 소프트웨어 등 분야를 초월해 공통되는 "좋은 디자인"의 원칙들을 체계적으로 정리해,

item.title: Claude Code, 앱 미리보기·코드 리뷰·PR 자동 수정·병합 기능 추가
item.content:encoded:
• 클로드 코드 데스크톱에서 개발 서버 실행과 앱 미리보기를 지원, 브라우저 전환 없이 UI·로그·오류 확인 가능
  • 로컬 변경사항을 분석하는 Review code 버튼으로 푸시 전 버그·잠재 이슈를 인라인 코멘트로 확인 가능
  • GitHub PR 상태를 앱 내에서 추적하고...

item.title: 보안 인가 신청서에 적지 말아야 할 것 (1988)
item.content:encoded:
• 12세 때 암호학 책을 읽고 만든 비밀 코드가 FBI의 첩보 사건으로 오해받은 일화를 다룸
  • 분실한 안경 케이스 속 암호 키가 일본 스파이의 증거로 오인되어 FBI가 수주간 수사 진행
  • 조사 후 FBI는 안경을 돌려줬지만 암호 키는 기록용으로 보관

item.title: LinkedIn 신원 인증을 하면 넘어가는 개인 정보들
item.content:encoded:
• LinkedIn의 신원 인증 절차는 사용자가 여권과 얼굴 사진을 제출하면 완료되지만, 실제 데이터는 LinkedIn이 아닌 미국 기업 Persona로 전달됨
  • Persona는 여권 사진, 얼굴 인식용 생체정보, NFC 칩 데이터, 기기 정보 및...

item.title: sql-tap - 터미널 UI 기반 실시간 SQL 트래픽 뷰어
item.content:encoded:
• PostgreSQL, MySQL, TiDB 등 주요 데이터베이스의 쿼리 흐름을 실시간으로 모니터링 및 시각화
  • 애플리케이션과 DB 사이 프록시(sql-tapd) 가 모든 SQL 요청을 가로채고, 이를 gRPC 스트림으...

item.title: Claws는 이제 LLM 에이전트 위에 추가된 새로운 계층임
item.content:encoded:
• LLM 위에 에이전트가 추가된 이후, 그 위에서 오케스트레이션·스케줄링·컨텍스트 관리·툴 호출·지속성을 담당하는 Claws 레이어가 등장함
  • 에이전트의 실행 구조를 한 단계 추상화해 더 높은 수준의 자동화와 구성 가능성 확보
  • OpenClaw는...

item.title: 2026년 데이터 엔지니어링의 향방 - 5가지 주요 트렌드
item.content:encoded:
• 데이터 엔지니어링 분야는 AI 확산과 기술 부채 누적이라는 이중 압력 속에서 양극화가 심화되는 흐름을 보임
  • AI 활용 수준이 경쟁력의 핵심으로, 일상적 사용이 보편화되며 “AI 보조”라는 표현 자체가 사라질 전망
  • 데이터 모델링과 시맨틱 ...

item.title: 실력 없음. 취향 없음.
item.content:encoded:
• LLM 시대에 누구나 앱을 만들 수 있게 되었지만, 진짜 장벽은 실력이 아닌 취향(taste) 이며, 이 장벽은 전혀 낮아지지 않았음
  • 공개되는 바이브 코딩 앱 대부분이 포화된 아이디어의 조잡한 복제물로, 실력과 취향 모두 부족한 최하위 사분면에 해...

item.title: 페이팔, 6개월간 사용자 정보 노출된 데이터 유출 공개
item.content:encoded:
• 대출 신청 시스템 오류로 인해 고객의 민감한 개인정보가 약 6개월간 외부에 노출됨
  • 노출된 정보에는 이름, 이메일, 전화번호, 사업장 주소, 사회보장번호, 생년월일 등이 포함
  • 페이팔은 문제를 발견한 다음날 코드 변경을 되돌...

item.title: MuMu Player (NetEase)가 macOS에서 30분마다 17개의 시스템 정찰 명령을 무단 실행
item.content:encoded:
• macOS용 MuMu Player Pro가 실행 중일 때 30분마다 시스템 정보를 자동 수집하며, 네트워크·프로세스·애플리케이션·커널 데이터를 포함
  • 수집 항목에는 로컬 네트워크 장치 목록, 실행 중인 프로세스 전체, 설치된 앱 메타데이터, hosts 파일, 커널 파라미터 등이 ...

item.title: Show HN: Llama 3.1 70B on a single RTX 3090 via NVMe-to-GPU bypassing the CPU
item.content:encoded: Comments

item.title: 미 전역에서 Flock 감시 카메라가 해체·파괴되고 있다
item.content:encoded:
• 미국 여러 지역에서 Flock Safety의 차량 번호판 인식 카메라(ALPR) 가 시민들에 의해 의도적으로 파괴되는 사례가 확산 중임
  • 이 카메라는 영장 없이 차량 이동 데이터를 수집·저장하며, ICE(이민세관단속국) 등 연방 기관과 데이터가 공유되는 것...

item.title: 아이들의 놀이 — 테크 업계의 새로운 세대와 사고의 종말
item.content:encoded:
• AI 시대 실리콘밸리에서 지능이나 전문성 대신 '에이전시'(agency, 행동력) 라 불리는 성격 특성이 가장 가치 있는 자질로 부상, 허가나 합의를 기다리지 않고 밀어붙이는 사람들이 VC 투자를 독점하는 구조
  • 컬럼비아대 중퇴생 Roy Lee가 공동 창업한 Cluely는 Zoo...

item.title: 위키백과, Archive.today 사용 중단 및 69만5천 개 링크 삭제 착수
item.content:encoded:
• 영어 위키백과가 Archive.today 사이트를 블랙리스트에 추가하고 링크 삭제를 시작함
  • 해당 사이트가 블로그를 대상으로 DDoS 공격을 유도하고 웹 스냅샷을 조작한 사실이 확인됨
  • 위키백과 편집자들은 사이트 신뢰성 훼손과 사용...

item.title: Show HN: Iron-Wolf – Wolfenstein 3D source port in Rust
item.content:encoded: Comments

item.title: MyMallow - RealityKit으로 구현한 3D 캐릭터 감정 일기
item.content:encoded:
사용자가 자신의 감정을 3D 캐릭터로 의인화하고 직접 꾸밀 수 있는 iOS 앱, MyMallow를 소개합니다. 2개월간 진행한 프로젝트로, 단순히 일기를 쓰는 것을 넘어 '사용자 참여형 3D 콘텐츠 생산' 에 초점을 맞추어 개발했습니다.

주요 기능

  • 커스텀

item.title: 코드를 읽지 않는 시대, 엔지니어는 무엇을 읽어야 하는가
item.content:encoded:
AI를 쓰면 학습이 줄어든다?

  • Anthropic 연구: AI로 코딩 과제를 완료한 개발자들의 퀴즈 점수가 17% 낮았다
  • 핵심은 "AI를 쓰면 학습이 줄어든다"가 아니라, 같은 AI를 쓰면서도 사용 방식에 따라 결과가 극명하게 갈렸다는 것
  • 코드를 통째로 맡긴 사람 →

item.title: Dependabot을 끄자
item.content:encoded:
• Dependabot의 과도한 알림이 실제 보안 문제 해결보다 개발자의 시간을 낭비하게 만든다는 지적
  • Go 생태계에서 발생한 사례처럼, 영향받지 않은 저장소에도 수천 개의 PR과 경고가 생성되어 혼란을 초래함
  • govulncheck 기반 GitHub Action

item.title: Show HN: A native macOS client for Hacker News, built with SwiftUI
item.content:encoded: Comments

item.title: Show HN: A geometric analysis of Chopin's Prelude No. 4 using 3D topology
item.content:encoded: Comments

item.title: Even GenAI uses Wikipedia as a source
item.content:encoded: Ryan is joined by Philippe Saade, the AI project lead at Wikimedia Deutschland, to dive into the Wikidata Embedding Project and how their team vectorized 30 million of Wikidata’s 119 million entries for semantic search.

item.title: Why Stack Overflow and Cloudflare launched a pay-per-crawl model
item.content:encoded: Inside the pay-per-crawl model colaunched by Stack Overflow and Cloudflare.

item.title: Mind the gap: Closing the AI trust gap for developers
item.content:encoded: Developer trust is synonymous with a willingness to deploy AI-generated code to production systems with minimal human review, as well as assurance that AI tools aren’t introducing unacceptable risks and technical debt that will burden you down the line.

item.title: Data is the new oil, and your database is the only way to extract it
item.content:encoded: Ryan sits down with Shireesh Thota, CVP of Azure Databases at Microsoft, to discuss the evolution of databases at Microsoft; Azure’s comprehensive portfolio that includes SQL Server, CosmosDB, and Postgres; and the challenges that come with database architecture, from the importance of cost governance and multi-cloud strategies to the future of databases when it comes to AI.

item.title: Even your voice is a data problem
item.content:encoded: Recorded last December at AWS re:Invent, Ryan welcomes CEO and co-founder of Deepgram, Scott Stephenson, for a conversation on advancing voice AI technology.

item.title: How everyone and anyone can use AI for good
item.content:encoded: There are big hitters in the AI space that use this tech for humanitarian and environmental good—from start-ups fighting climate change to voice recognition experts diagnosing diseases. But you don't need to be backed by AWS or Microsoft to do good. In part two of this series, we dive into how anyone can use AI for good.

item.title: Is anyone using AI for good?
item.content:encoded: In a world where AI is replacing human workers, using up energy and water, and deepening disconnect, is AI for humanitarian good even possible? The answer is yes. In the first part of this two-part series, we're taking a look at just a few AI do-gooders and what they're doing to fight climate change, make healthcare more accessible, and help their communities.

item.title: The logos, ethos, and pathos of your LLMs
item.content:encoded: Ryan is joined by Professor Tom Griffiths, the head of Princeton University’s AI Lab, to dive into findings from his new book The Laws of Thought, which explores the history of the philosophy, mathematics, and logic that underlie artificial intelligence, and scientists' efforts to describe our minds using mathematics.

item.title: Why demand for code is infinite: How AI creates more developer jobs
item.content:encoded: Not only is there a future for software development, but we’re on the cusp of enormous demand for code developed by humans.

item.title: AI attention span so good it shouldn’t be legal
item.content:encoded: We have another two-for-one special this week, with two more interviews from the floor of re:Invent.

item.title: Code smells for AI agents: Q&A with Eno Reyes of Factory
item.content:encoded: Quality software still needs high-quality code, AI agents or not.

item.title: Generating text with diffusion (and ROI with LLMs)
item.content:encoded: Two guests for the price of one! This episode has two interviews recorded at AWS re:Invent back in December.

item.title: What’s new at Stack Overflow: February 2026
item.content:encoded: This month, we’ve launched several improvements to AI Assist, opened Chat to all users on Stack Overflow, launched custom badges across the network, and launched one of the first community-authored coding challenges.

item.title: Wanna see a CSS magic trick?
item.content:encoded: Ryan is joined by Chris Coyier, founder of CSS Tricks and CodePen, to talk all about what the state of the art of CSS is today, including new features like variables and scroll-driven animations.

item.title: Scaling enterprise AI: lessons in governance and operating models from IBM
item.content:encoded: Successful implementation and scaling of enterprise AI projects is fundamentally a people and operating model challenge, not just a technology problem.

item.title: Are you learning with AI? We want to know about it!
item.content:encoded: We're running a survey to understand how people are using AI to learn and whether that's helping, hurting, and replacing tools.

item.title: Are bugs and incidents inevitable with AI coding agents?
item.content:encoded: What specific kind of bugs is AI more likely to generate? Do some categories of bugs show up more often? How severe are they? How is this impacting production environments?

item.title: Spy vs spy at scale
item.content:encoded: Ryan welcomes Anthony Vinci, former senior intelligence officer and author of The Fourth Intelligence Revolution, to explore AI’s evolving role in intelligence in places like translation and image analysis, the challenges of evolving modern tech into government infrastructure, and the importance of democratized intelligence so citizens can keep themselves and loved ones safe.

item.title: Stack Gives Back 2025!
item.content:encoded: We’re excited to announce our 17th annual Stack Gives Back campaign donations.

item.title: AI can 10x developers...in creating tech debt
item.content:encoded: Ryan sits down with Michael Parker, VP of Engineering at TurinTech to discuss the newest kind of tech debt—AI-generated tech debt. They dive into the uneven productivity results of AI tools, how tech teams are evolving their roles and work in response to these massive technological shifts, and what the nervous developer can do to maintain joy in their work.

item.title: Automate your security whack-a-mole: Q&A with Exaforce
item.content:encoded: Security controls can be a bit of a cat and mouse game—you block one attack, new ones spring up.

item.title: Is that allowed? Authentication and authorization in Model Context Protocol
item.content:encoded: Learn how to protect MCP servers from unauthorized access and how authentication of MCP clients to MCP servers works.

item.title: Don’t let your backend write checks your frontend can’t cache
item.content:encoded: Ryan welcomes Prakash Chandran, CEO and co-founder of Xano, to the show to discuss the intricate relationship between frontend and backend development, the potential challenges that universal frontend interfaces pose for developers, and the importance of understanding both your frontend and your backend when using AI code.

item.title: How AWS re:Invented the cloud
item.content:encoded: From the floor at AWS re:Invent, Ryan is joined by AWS Senior Principal Engineer David Yanacek to chat about all things AWS, from the truth behind AWS’s Black Friday origin mythos to the development of essential cloud tools like SQS and DynamoDB. Plus, how David envisions autonomous agents will ease developers' operational burdens.

item.title: How Stack Overflow is taking on spam and bad actors
item.content:encoded: If a new post looks very similar to content that has been recently removed for being spam, it's likely spam too.

item.title: Transforming enterprise workflows: How IBM is unlocking AI's potential
item.content:encoded: Learn how IBM deployed and integrated AI tools in the ultimate enterprise environment.

item.title: If you're a Zoomer, this one's for you: Everything Gen Z needs to know about the 2025 tech landscape
item.content:encoded: Here's the lowdown on all the tech from 2025 that you, dear Zoomer, should know about.

item.title: 8 lessons from tech leadership on scaling teams and AI
item.content:encoded: What we learned from the first year of Leaders of Code.

item.title: Vibe code anything in a Hanselminute
item.content:encoded: Ryan welcomes back the mighty Scott Hanselman, VP of Developer Community at Microsoft, for a crossover episode about all things vibe coding.

item.title: Now everyone can chat on Stack Overflow
item.content:encoded: Registered users can now join public chat rooms from day one, making it easier to connect, learn, and participate in the community

item.title: Every ecommerce hero needs a Sidekick
item.content:encoded: Ryan is joined by Vanessa Lee, VP of Product at Shopify, to discuss how AI is a tech renaissance and how these new technologies are affecting the ecommerce world. They cover the development of Sidekick, along with the general challenges of building AI tools, the importance of maintaining human oversight in AI, and what the future holds for personalized user experiences in ecommerce.

item.title: You need quality engineers to turn AI into ROI
item.content:encoded: Pete Johnson, Field CTO, Artificial Intelligence at MongoDB, joins the podcast to say that looking at AI’s impact as a job killer is a flawed metric.

item.title: Search engine bots crawled so AI bots could run
item.content:encoded: Ryan hosts Akamai data scientist Robert Lester on the show to discuss how the growth of AI bots affects internet traffic, the ways these AI bots differ from the original search engine optimization ones, and why you might not want to mitigate AI bots on your websites.

item.title: What’s new at Stack Overflow: January 2026
item.content:encoded: For this first edition of the new year, we’re taking a step back to highlight some of the most impactful features shipped over the last year and how they can help you start 2026 strong.

item.title: A new worst coder has entered the chat: vibe coding without code knowledge
item.content:encoded: In the age of AI, being able to make applications and create code has never been easier. But is it any good? Here's what vibe coding is like for someone without technical skills.

item.title: The most dangerous shortcuts in software
item.content:encoded: Ryan sits down with Tom Totenberg, head of release automation at LaunchDarkly, to discuss the perils of taking too many shortcuts in software development, how business pressures and AI code tools have contributed to dangerous corner cutting, and the importance of balancing speed with sustainability to maintain system integrity.

item.title: Documents: The architect’s programming language
item.content:encoded: Senior developers know how to deploy code to systems made of code. Architects know how to deploy ideas to systems made of people.

item.title: A look under the hood: How (and why) we built Question Assistant
item.content:encoded: Evaluating question quality and determining the appropriate feedback required some classic ML techniques in addition to our GenAI solution.

item.title: A new era of Stack Overflow
item.content:encoded: Live from the stage of WeAreDevelopers, we’re unveiling our new vision and mission for the future of Stack Overflow and our community.
